articles.author: Mohammed Salem, Hatem Khaled, Emma Farge, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: In the ruins of his two-storey home, 11-year-old Mohammed gathers chunks of the fallen roof into a broken pail and pounds them into gravel which his father will use to make gravestones for victims of the Gaza war.
articles.title: After a year of war, Gazans wonder how to deal with tonnes of rubble

articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Laila Bassam
articles.description: The strikes came after days of bombing by Israel of Beirut suburbs considered strongholds for Hezbollah.
articles.title: Heavy strikes shake Beirut as Israel expands Lebanon campaign

articles.author: Leigh Thomas
articles.description: Thousands of protesters took to the streets in several major cities around the world on Saturday to demand an end to bloodshed in Gaza, as the conflict in the Palestinian enclave approaches its first anniversary and spreads in the wider region.
articles.title: Anniversary of Gaza war draws thousands of pro-Palestinian protesters around the world

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian air attacks on Ukraine kept the eastern half of the country under air raid alert for more than five hours, Ukraine's military said early on Sunday, with Moscow launching several waves of strikes targeting Kyiv and other cities.
articles.title: Russia launches air attack on Kyiv, Odesa, Ukraine says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Tunisia's polling stations opened on Sunday for the country's presidential election, with three candidates running, including one in jail.
articles.title: Tunisia polling stations open for presidential election

articles.author: Eduardo Simões, Anthony Boadle
articles.description: Brazilians vote on Sunday for mayors and city councilors in more than 5,500 municipal elections, with polls showing conservative candidates running strong in several major cities, setting the country's political landscape ahead of a 2026 presidential race.
articles.title: Brazil votes in local elections with eyes on 2026 presidential showdown

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: India's ruling party is projected to have lost two key provincial elections to the main opposition Congress party and its allies, exit polls showed, suggesting another setback after the party fared poorly in national elections.
articles.title: India's ruling party set to lose two state elections, exit polls show

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese hackers accessed the networks of U.S. broadband providers and obtained information from systems that the federal government uses for court-authorized wiretapping, the Wall Street Journal reported on Saturday.
articles.title: Chinese hackers breached US court wiretap systems, WSJ reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Leaders of China and North Korea on Sunday traded a vow of enhanced bilateral cooperation on the 75th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the two countries, state news agency KCNA reported.
articles.title: China and North Korea mark 75th anniversary of ties with vows of cooperation

articles.author: Steven Aristil
articles.description: Haiti is reeling after the Gran Grif gang killed at least 70 people, including infants, in Pont-Sondé, and forcing over 6,000 residents to flee.
articles.title: Haitian prime minister goes abroad for support after gang massacre
